body:
This issue is same as https://github.com/Dart-Code/Dart-Code/issues/3540 for Android Studio IDE, I have different versions of flutter sdk located at

```
$HOME/Documents/
```
as shown in the image

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31410839/132670322-5a6f876d-8b7c-45bf-9cb7-b6a589262b16.png)

when I change the flutter sdk and look at the definition of any source code it points to the old source code. The code references only update when we call `flutter pub get`.

## Steps to Reproduce

1. Open a  flutter project in Android Studio
2. run `flutter pub get`
3. Click on Any class and see the source code file location 
4. Change the flutter SDK path
5. repeat step 3 again
  
### Expected Output

Updated source code must be shown when looking at the Class definition

### Actual Output

Old source code is shown when looking at the Class definition.


### Proposal

To automatically call `flutter pub get` when the SDK path updates


## Version info


Thanks
title: Source code does not get updated when changing SDK paths in Android Studio
